intro: Perrierangraecum letouzeyi, commonly known as the Cape Peninsula dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to coastal and Mediterranean climates. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained environments and is often found in coastal dunes and cliffs. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the study of South African flora.
